com.github.ldeitos.validators

Class AbstractExtendedValidator<A extends Annotation,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ldeitos.validators.AbstractExtendedValidator<A,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - Constraint annotation
    T - Type in validation.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator<A,T>

    public abstract class AbstractExtendedValidator<A extends Annotation,T>
extends Object
implements jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator<A,T>
    Abstraction to provide easy way to create validator with multiple violation registers.
    Since:
    0.8.0
    Author:
    Leandro Deitos

      • isValid

        P.S.: Can't be override by concrete implementations.
        Specified by:

      • doValidation

        public abstract void doValidation(T value)
        Extension point to implement validation code.
        This code is invoked during API isValid(Object, ConstraintValidatorContext) call and violation must be registered by any methods below:
        • addViolation(String, String...)
        • addViolationWithDefaultTemplate(String...)
        Parameters:
        value - Value in validation.
        Since:
        0.8.0

      • addViolationWithDefaultTemplate

        protected void addViolationWithDefaultTemplate(String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with default message template, defined in Constraint annotation, and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.8.0

      • addViolationWithDefaultTemplate

        protected void addViolationWithDefaultTemplate(Path atPath,
                                   String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with default message template, defined in Constraint annotation, and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        atPath - Full Path to origin of violation in object being validated.
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • addViolationWithDefaultTemplate

        protected void addViolationWithDefaultTemplate(PathBuilder pathBuilder,
                                   String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with default message template, defined in Constraint annotation, and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        pathBuilder - PathBuilder to build Path reference.
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • addViolation

        protected void addViolation(String msgTemplate,
                String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with informed message template and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        msgTemplate - Message template can be:
        - Just message text, like "My message";
        - Message text with parameters, like "My {0} message" or "My {par} message";
        - Message key to get message in parameterized MessagesSource, like {my.message.key}.
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.8.0

      • addViolation

        protected void addViolation(Path path,
                String msgTemplate,
                String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with informed message template and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        path - Full Path to origin of violation in object being validated.
        msgTemplate - Message template can be:
        - Just message text, like "My message";
        - Message text with parameters, like "My {0} message" or "My {par} message";
        - Message key to get message in parameterized MessagesSource, like {my.message.key}.
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • addViolation

        protected void addViolation(PathBuilder pathBuilder,
                String msgTemplate,
                String... msgParameters)
        Makes value on validation invalid and add a violation with informed message template and parameters to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        pathBuilder - PathBuilder to build Path reference.
        msgTemplate - Message template can be:
        - Just message text, like "My message";
        - Message text with parameters, like "My {0} message" or "My {par} message";
        - Message key to get message in parameterized MessagesSource, like {my.message.key}.
        msgParameters - Parameters to be interpolated in message violation.
        Can be informed in "value" pattern, to be interpolated in indexed parameter like "My {0} message" or in "key=value" pattern, to be interpolated in defined parameter like "My {par} message".
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • buildPath

        protected PathBuilder buildPath(String path)
        Builder to describe a simple Path to violation origin. Usage examples: 
         //assuming the following domain model
 public class Address {
     public String getStreet() { ... }
     public Country getCountry() { ... }
 }
 
 //From a class level constraint on Address
 //Build a constraint violation on the default path + "street"
 //i.e. the street property of Address
 buildPath("street");
        Parameters:
        path - String representation of path to property to register violation.
        Returns:
        PathBuilder to build a Path reference.
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • buildPath

        protected PathBuilder buildPath(String path,
                    Object key)
        Builder to describe a mapped Path to violation origin. Usage examples: 
         //assuming the following domain model
 public class User {
     public Map getAddresses() { ... }
 }

 public class Address {
     public String getStreet() { ... }
     public Country getCountry() { ... }
 }

 public class Country {
     public String getName() { ... }
 }

 //From a class level constraint on User
 //Build a constraint violation on the default path + addresses["home"].country.name
 //i.e. property "country.name" on the object stored under "home" in the map
 buildPath("addresses", "home").add("country").add("name")
        
 or 
        
 buildPath("addresses[home].country.name")

        

 P.S.: A full path build like buildPath("addresses[home].country.name"), when refers a map,
 only can be used when a map key is a String, in other way, uses a fluent model, like
 buildPath("addresses", aObject).add("country").add("name").
        Parameters:
        path - String representation of path to property to register violation.
        key - Key to mapped content to registered violation.
        Returns:
        PathBuilder to build a Path reference.
        Since:
        0.9.1

      • atKey

        protected Path atKey(Object key)
        Return a Path to property level mapped content.
        Usage examples: 
         //assuming the following domain model
 public class User {
     public Map getAddresses() { ... }
 }

 public class Address {
     public String getStreet() { ... }
     public Country getCountry() { ... }
 }

 //From a property-level constraint on User.addresses
 //Build a constraint violation on the default path + the bean stored
 //under the "home" key on map:
  atKey("home")
        Parameters:
        key - Key to mapped collection content to registered violation.
        Returns:
        Correspondent Path.
        Since:
        0.9.1

      • buildPath

        protected PathBuilder buildPath(String path,
                    Integer index)
        Builder to describe a indexed Path to violation origin. Usage examples: 
         //assuming the following domain model
 public class User {
     public List getAddresses() { ... }
 }

 public class Address {
     public String getStreet() { ... }
     public Country getCountry() { ... }
 }

 //From a class level constraint on User
 //Build a constraint violation on the default path + addresses(2).country.name
 //i.e. property "country.name" on the object stored under index 2 in the list
 buildPath("addresses", 2).add("country").add("name")
        
 or 
        
 buildPath("addresses(2).country.name")

        Parameters:
        path - String representation of path to property to register violation.
        index - Index to indexed collection content to registered violation.
        Returns:
        PathBuilder to build a Path reference.
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • atIndex

        protected Path atIndex(Integer index)
        Return a Path to property level indexed collection content.
        Usage examples: 
         //assuming the following domain model
 public class User {
     public List getAddresses() { ... }
 }

 public class Address {
     public String getStreet() { ... }
     public Country getCountry() { ... }
 }

 //From a property-level constraint on User.addresses
 //Build a constraint violation on the default path + the bean stored
 //under the index 2 on list:
  atIndex(2)
        Parameters:
        index - Index to indexed collection content to registered violation.
        Returns:
        Correspondent Path.
        Since:
        0.9.0
